title: Region bounded by trig and exp functions

content.question: Let f and g be the functions given by f(x) = 1 + sin(2x) and g(x) = ex/2. Let R be the shaded region in the first quadrant enclosed by the graphs of f and g as shown in the figure above. (a) Find the area of R.

frqParts.text: Let f and g be the functions given by f(x) = 1 + sin(2x) and g(x) = ex/2. Let R be the shaded region in the first quadrant enclosed by the graphs of f and g as shown in the figure above. (a) Find the area of R.
(b) Find the volume of the solid generated when R is revolved about the x-axis.

(c) The region R is the base of a solid. For this solid, the cross sections perpendicular to the x-axis are semicircles with diameters extending from y = f(x) to y = g(x). Find the volume of this solid.

topic.text: 8.4: Finding the Area Between Curves Expressed as Functions of x

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Apply an appropriate mathematical definition, theorem, or test.
